Index Tags Book Report

all the tags

this page is made to have a quick reference to all the tags learned in the to be dangerous book. With this page, you can format index to look like a normal page, and not be a disgusting mess of tags. this paragraph uses the strong and italicized(emphasized) tags, but below we will work with things like table
for a good list of tags, the teachers hate it, but honestly w3schools has a lot of information on html.

There are two main element(tag) types, block or inline. Inline elements will not break the line on the website, where as block elements will start a new line. Below are some inline and block elements.

Block Elements
tag name purpose
h1–h6 headings include a heading(levels 1–6)
p paragraph include a paragraph of text
table table inclue a table
tr table row inclue a row of data in table
th table header make a table header
td table data inclue a table data cell
ol ordered list create a numbered list
ul unordered list create a list using bullet points
br break enter line break
div division defines a section of code for styling(unseen by user)
header header element defines section of header for styling(unseen by user)
blockquote blockquote defines a quote from another source(can be cited with source="")
li list item creates a list item in an ordered or unordered list

Inline Elements
Tag Name purpose Example Result
em emphasized make emphasized(italicized) text <em>technical sophistication</em> technical sophistication
Strong Bold make text stronger(bolder) <strong>One Million Dollars<strong> One Million Dollars
a hyperlink create a hyperlink(to website or file) <a href="https://www.google.com">click here<a> click here
img image define an image from file location or website(bad practice to use website, because you need to rely on that site not changing or going down) <img src="/file/location.jpg" alt="text if no image">
code code used to define a piece of code and display in monospace font <code>strong<code> strong
span span tag used to define a section of text(unseen by user) <span>make me red in css or here idk</span>

Document tags

tag Name purpose Example
html html tag container for all elements <html>everything</html>
head head tag contains document information(tab title, styles, etc.) <head>title and stuff</head>
body body tag defines document body(what you see) <body>headers and stuff</body>
title title tag adds title to windows tab <title>example site name</title>
meta metadata tag describe document metadata(document information) <meta charset="UTF-8">
